title: The Net Project
text:
Title of the intervention
The Net-Community Based Malaria Programme


Lead applicant
Amici del Mondo - World Friends Onlus (WF)


Partner
Department of Health, Kilifi County



Centro Salute Globale della Regione Toscana, A.O.U. Meyer


Country of the intervention
Kenya


Location of the intervention
Kilifi County (Ganze, Kaloleni Kilifi North, Kilifi South, Rabai)


Duration of the intervention
24 months







To quantify the number of Malaria suspected and confirmed cases (over 5 and under 5) in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries, Sub-counties and County.
To determine the prevalence of malaria in Children (6-59 months) in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries, Sub-counties and County.
To quantify malaria positive cases (under 5) and total tested for malaria (under 5) in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries, Sub-counties and County.
To quantify the total laboratory test conducted (RDT and microscope), positivity rate and type of infection in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries, Sub-counties and County.
To determine the percentage of the population who slept under a ITN (insecticide treated net) the night before in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries, Sub-counties and County.
To calculate the percentage of population who have access to a ITN (insecticide treated net) the night before in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries (CHU), Sub-counties and County.
To determine percentage of malaria positive cases treated (over 5 and under 5) in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for communities, dispensaries, Sub-counties and County.
To quantify the number of intermittent preventive treatment of malaria during pregnancy delivered in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) dispensaries (CHU), Sub-counties and County.
To determine the reporting rates of MOH 515 and MOH 705 A/B in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025 (first quarter) for community health extension workers and dispensaries included in the project, but also for Sub-Counties and County.








Disclaimer

title: Executive summary
text:
The Net – Community Based Malaria Programme was implemented in Kilifi County, Kenya, between 2023 and 2025. This was in response to several concerns raised by the Kenya coastal health authorities regarding the fight against malaria. Some of the concerns raised include low usage and access to insecticide treated nets (ITNs), low adherence to Intermittent Preventive Treatment in pregnancy (IPTp), incorrect information about malaria, challenges in screening, diagnosis, and follow up and over-treatment of malaria.
This project aimed to “Contribute to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goal 3.3 By 2030, end the malaria epidemic and 3.8: Achieve Universal Health Coverage”. More specifically, the aim was to “Strengthen community-based malaria eradication mechanisms within Kilifi County, Kenya by 2024”.
We expected to achieve these goals by implementing several activities:

prevention of transmission through raising awareness on use of bed nets
capacity building of [missing text] and community case management
strengthening of data collection tools at community level and county monitoring mechanisms (Kenya Health Information System)

This report aims to document the impact of The Net’s activities and their outcomes in Kilifi County, describe the acceptance and sustainability of the initiative by the beneficiaries and stakeholders.

Study sites

title: Ganze
text: There were two dispensaries in Ganze subcounty: Ganze and Jaribuni.

title: Kaloleni
text: There were two dispensaries in Kaloleni subcounty: Kinarani and Mgamboni.

title: Kilifi North
text: There were two dispensaries in Kilifi North subcounty: Kiwandani and Kadzinuni.

title: Kilifi South
text: There were two dispensaries in Kilifi South: Pingilikani and Tunzanani.

title: Rabai
text: There were two dispensaries in Rabai subcounty: Lenga and Makanzani.

title: Kilifi South
text: There were two dispensaries in Kilifi South: Pingilikani and Tunzanani.
